choices.answer: Created to seek pleasure
Created so God wouldn't be lonely
Created in God's image and likeness
Created to be successful in life

questions.question: The Incarnation refers to the fact that...

choices.answer: Jesus ascended into heaven, body and soul
Jesus, who is fully God, became man
Jesus committed sins like we do
Jesus was just a carpenter and not our savior
Are examples of how we should live our lives
Are deceased Catholics that we worship
Are a special few called by God
Are nice people who put up with us

questions.question: Theology of the Body answers two big questions...

choices.answer: Who I should marry? and Who I should invite to my wedding?
Should I be Catholic? and Should I go to Mass?
Should I go to college? and Should I get a job?
Who am I? and How should I live?

questions.question: In His Image and Likeness reminds us that...

choices.answer: We are perfect like God
We are to give ourselves to another person in perfect love
We are part human and part divine like Jesus
We can never really sin

questions.question: The way God created US In the Beginning is...

choices.answer: Not important to the way we should live
subject to our own personal desires
The way humans were designed to live
not something that matters in today's world
So we could sin and not worry about it
So Satan could use us for his purposes
So we could choose to love Him and each other
Because Adam and Eve sinned
prone to committing sin, even when we try not to
stronger than temptation
hopeless cases that God can not save
candidates for sainthood

questions.question: The Language of the Body reveals truths about...

choices.answer: Anatomy, Biology, Medicine, and Natural Law
Popularity, grooming, and healthy choices
Fashion, exercise, and society's expectations
The human soul, God, our relationships and how we should act

questions.question: Jesus' Resurrection makes it possible for us to look forward to...

choices.answer: The reunion of our own bodies and souls after our death
Forgiveness of our sins whether we are sorry for them or not
A "free pass" from all our sins
A trouble-free life of nothing but comfort and joy

questions.question: The Ascension of Jesus after His Resurrection means He is in Heaven...

choices.answer: As a spirit or ghost
With His broken body from the crucifixion
With His truly human body joined forever with His soul
But only for a limited time
Always something we do that's wrong and hard to resist
Something we should avoid at all costs
Something we do when no one is looking
An act repeated until it becomes part of our character
A part of our character that we cannot control
A good habit that helps us love God and others freely
An old habit that's usually hard to break
A punishment for our sins
Are bad habits
Enslave us to selfishness
Rob us of our power to love
All of the above

questions.question: Grace is God's free gift of divine life given to us...

choices.answer: Through Jesus Christ
Through hard work
Through a lifetime of service
Whether we want it or not
Gifts reserved for Priests and Sisters
Something most of us will never experience
Visible signs of invisible realities
Received once we get to heaven

questions.question: Reconciliation or confession is a sacrament that...

choices.answer: We can only receive just before our First Holy Communion
we can give to ourselves
Allows us to express sorrow and have our souls wiped clean
The greatest of all sacraments
Just bread and wine that is offered at Mass
A sacrament only a Bishop can provide
Something we will not receive until we get to heaven

questions.question: The Dignity of the Human Person means...

choices.answer: We treat each other as "someones" and not "somethings"
We treat others however we would like
God doesn't care how I view others
We aren't expected to be gentlemen and ladies
